New Records: Qatar achieved a new record with 10 corners in the first half against India.
Qatar won their match 3-0 against India, a new high in their head-to-head record.
Key Match Events: Qatar scored early through Moustafa Mashal in the 4th minute.
India had several missed chances, including a penalty save by Amrinder Singh.
Qatar doubled their lead with Almoez Ali in the 46th minute.
India's only bright spot was a late substitution and a chance by Sahal Abdul Samad.
Qatar sealed their victory with Yusuf Abdurisag's header five minutes before full time.
Post-Match Reflections: Igor Stimac, the India coach, acknowledged Qatar's dominance and the need for improvement.
The match was a significant challenge for India ahead of their upcoming tournaments.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Amrinder Singh made several crucial saves but couldn't prevent the loss.
Qatar's constant pressure led to 10 corners in the first half.
